page.title: 04CATERHAM HIGH STREET PAGE 2
page.content: This was once a coal merchants and the horse and cart would pass through the arch to the yard at the back. The King & Queen is a very old pub. It is not known after which monarchs it was named. Historians made a "dig" behind the pub before a car park was made. Pieces of pottery from{MIDDLE {AGES}were found. A row of cottages named Roffey Place used to stand next to the village jewellers. E.B. Butlers shop was built on the site. Nearly opposite the old Rectory stood 3 cottages, one of which was the old bakery. Only one cottage still remains. The{OLD RECTORY,}now called{CEDAR {HOUSE}is said to be haunted by the ghost of a little girl. Outside is a CEDAR TREE about 250 years old. It is said that if you talk under this tree you will have a{CURSE}put on you.
